page.title: 19LANDSCAPE
page.content: RIVER WHARFE THE RIVER WHARFE FLOWS BELOW THE RIDGE OF MILLSTONE GRIT.THERE ARE FOOTPATHS ALONG ITS BANKS WHICH ARE ENJOYED BY FISHERMEN AND WALKERS.THE FOLLOWING FISH CAN BE FOUND IN THE RIVER-PIKE, ROACH,PERCH,CHUB,TROUT,BARBEL,EEL. THE WHARFE IS DANGEROUS FOR SWIMMING BECAUSE OF HOLES AND CURRENTS.NOTICES WARN OF THE DANGERS. THERE ARE 3 CARAVAN SITES ON THE NORTHERN BANK AT NETHERBY.MAUSTIN CARAVAN PARK AND SPRINGWOOD ARE THE LARGEST.THESE ARE OPEN FOR RESIDENTIAL CARAVANS AND TOURERS(Â£3.50 PER NIGHT, MARCH TO SEPTEMBER).FISHING PERMITS CAN BE OBTAINED.THE HAREWOOD HILL CLIMB TAKES PLACE AT STOCKTON FARM IN THE WHARFE VALLEY.THE STEEP HILLSIDE IS USED AS A HILL CLIMB,AND IS OFTEN A 'SPECIAL'STAGE IN THE RAC RALLY.
